body: I've been asking myself for a long time. What's with Japan and their NTR fetishes anyway? Are there many beta guys in that country who desired to be cucked? Or is it a reflection of their current society? I've heard from Japanese Youtubers that cheating there is prevalent due to their workaholic men.

It's kinda weird how the artist painted this woman to look sad and remorseful of what she did, but in reality she CHOSE to cheat on her husband through her make-believe 'guilt', not once, but THREE times, and the third time completely out of her own free will. She will always be a cheater, and will continue to do so, until the end, given chance and enough of her own self deluded reasons to self-pity, ahe CHOSE to not talk about it with her husband and just slept around. She may look like she's pitiable and deserves pity from the way the artist drew her, but she is not. She simply isn't evil enough to boast about her infidelity to her husband, that's it. I'd imagine, again, that given chance, if she DOES get in a relationship ever again after her divorce, she will cheat again... Maybe she will willingly, maybe she will be forced by her past partners, through blackmailing, but I doubt she'll put up much of a fight even then. She is by every definition of the word, a slut. Nothing more.

@random_stranger The story is well written to accurately describe the dilemma of dealing with uncovered cheating, BUT I don't find it totally realistic. A 50/50. Its characters cannot be said to be realistic: A pathetic MC who hasn't had sex for 4 years is possible but not an everyday thing (realistic), a woman who is unfaithful to her husband with guys who have nothing in common (not even the physical nor in the personality) seems to me completely fictitious. It's just a way the author wants the reader to identify with these stereotypes. I repeat, the story reflects well the problem of a couple facing infidelity, but the reason and the development of this infidelity is fiction.

Komatsuzwa (middle-aged man) is probably the best person in this torrid affair. He is observant, intelligent, and even empathetic. He offered wise counsel and was even willing to not sleep with her. He obviously wasn't going to refuse what was offered, but that's not something I can fault him over. Naoki (MC) did not want to reveal he was infertile, it's the kind of thing a man finds a crushing blow. He should not have avoided sleeping with his wife, he should have told her, but it's the kind of thing that hurts. Ah, but you, Akiko... no excuses. Her infidelity is her own choice, done despite the love she still feels. So many people here trying to excuse her, but there is no excuse. Communication is essential, selfish betrayal is not.

This is one of the better done doujins, that accurately depicts infidelity in a grounded situation. He's in the wrong for not being honest with her, and she's a selfish person who didn't open up to her husband about how she felt. Clearly there's no real winner here, and in the end they both chose the wrong path and made mistakes. Life rarely goes smoothly, and it's rarely one-sided. As others have said, it leaves you with a sort of empty, bittersweet feeling. Regular NTR directs your hatred towards 1 character usually, but they both felt remorse here, and the epilogue shows their resolve (hers at least) to move on. Honestly it's the best possible outcome.
well NTR with proper closure. an english TL and not just a summary paints a diffrent picture. I would like a sequel where both have different partners and can be friendly again.

@xyst16 finally someone see my point here. That's why the author's writing of fmc's character is really good imo. I could understand why she had to leave the shadows of her past behind (her ex-husband) in order to start fresh, but still, deleting him off without telling him SHOWED us that she's still a selfish individual, until the very end, and that's A CONSISTENT WRITING from the author. Because she even more than once admitted that she's a self centered individual and that doesn't make you automatically evil, instead it made you more relatable. I really hope this cheating hentai series could be an example of other infidelity/cheating hentai to encourage authors to write their story better. I mean, yeah it's 100% for fap material, but when you made a good story, then your story would be praised for its' writing too.

@ TheBLACKDahlia I agree with this as a very well written story. Although I have commented couple times, after knowing this story, I just wanna give more comments for this well written story. Idk if I'd side with fmc, but one thing I know, I respect the way author wrote her. I like that the author made her realizing her mistakes, her fallouts, and her personality. It'd be your generic infidelity/cheating story if the women who got fucked by other guys were always PORTRAYED as a victim. Not in this case with this hentai. She's just a selfish individual & there are literally lots of people irl like her (regardless of the gender) who failed to save their marriage & that's why there are a lot of divorce cases. Most people irl are selfish, and that's why the writing really felt too real. I'm also glad that the MC was written very relatable too, not suddenly BEGGING ON HIS KNEES ASKING TO CONTINUE THEIR MARRIAGE JUST BECAUSE HE WAS AROUSED KNOWING HIS WIFE GOT FUCKED BY OTHER DUDES
This was so good that I favorited it without even realizing it. This has never happened before. Not a massive ntr fan, but this is gold.

This is BY FAR the best-written netorare story I've ever read!!! There are so many times I got infuriated with both characters, but their actions and responses were quite realistic and all of their actions made sense based on their own circumstances. I see a lot of comments hating on FMC but I found myself on FMC's side after the MC left her without sex and kept that secret for FOUR YEARS!!! Clearly, the breakdown in communication was an issue back at that point in the relationship, and it took them four years to finally come to terms with it (in a less-than-ideal way). Still, a 10/10 story for me and one of my favorites on this website!
This is well-written, has great art, relatable characters... man, I loved & enjoyed reading the entire thing, even with the feels. What a rollercoaster, a masterpiece.
